snippet: The untitled drama centered on a morning TV show is the tech giant’s second play against traditional networks and Netflix.

headline.main: Apple Lands New Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston TV Show
headline.print_headline: Apple to Show a Drama About Morning TV

snippet: The Paradise Papers confirm what we already know: Many are not paying their fair share. Here's how they get away with it.

headline.main: How Corporations and the Wealthy Avoid Taxes (and How to Stop Them)

snippet: That man who killed 26 people had an iPhone and the authorities want to gain access to it. But as in an earlier case, it is locked with a password.

headline.main: Why Texas Shooting Could Draw Apple Back Into Security Debate
headline.print_headline: New Debate Seems Likely Over iPhone Of Gunman

snippet: If Apple chooses to settle its lawsuit against Qualcomm, it could preserve the company’s independence from Broadcom.

headline.main: Will Qualcomm Agree to a Deal With Broadcom? Ask Apple
headline.print_headline: Will Qualcomm Agree to a Deal With Broadcom? Ask Apple

snippet: Two new books offer startlingly different conclusions on Silicon Valley’s influence on our economy, culture and politics.

headline.main: Review: Two Contrasting Views of Silicon Valley’s Influence
headline.print_headline: Review: Two Contrasting Views of Silicon Valley’s Influence

snippet: We don’t need to make it easier for companies to bilk us.

headline.main: Paradise Papers Show How Misguided the G.O.P. Is on Taxes
headline.print_headline: The Rich Don’t Need More Help

snippet: Many participants in a recent study failed to recreate famous logos from brands like Apple and Starbucks. But some experts say that shouldn’t worry companies.

headline.main: Can You Draw the Starbucks Logo Without Cheating? Probably Not.
headline.print_headline: Logo Recall Is Not What You’d Think

snippet: The tech giant has found a tax haven in the island of Jersey, leaving billions of dollars untouched by the United States, leaked documents reveal.

headline.main: After a Tax Crackdown, Apple Found a New Shelter for Its Profits
headline.print_headline: Island-Hopping Saved Apple Billions in Taxes

byline.original: By JESSE DRUCKER and SIMON BOWERS

snippet: Apple Inc has ordered two seasons of a dramatic series that stars Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston and looks at the lives of people working on a morning television show, a company spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Apple Orders Witherspoon, Aniston Drama in TV Push
headline.print_headline: Apple Orders Witherspoon, Aniston Drama in TV Push

snippet: Apple Inc said none of its operations were moved from Ireland and that changes made to its corporate structure in 2015 were specially designed to preserve tax payments to the United States, and not to reduce taxes anywhere else.

headline.main: Apple Says No Operations Were Moved From Ireland
headline.print_headline: Apple Says No Operations Were Moved From Ireland
